channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain blocker yet again, 9th December
item.description:
Everytime it rains big flood on road and pavement. Council workers used a stick recently to prod drain but problem not solved. It needs jet washing or vacuum to sort blockage. A real problem as pedestrians have to walk in road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Langdon Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible NRSWA non-compliance, 9th December
item.description:
Recent telecom/utility works installed a cabinet and dug across the pavement. The reinstatement is uneven, poorly compacted, and looks likely to degrade quickly in bad weather. Possible NRSWA non-compliance. Please inspect and require the contractor to redo the reinstatement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin shelter blocking pavement, 9th December
item.description:
On tennyson road this bin shelter is blocking the pavement. I have recently seen someone take a bag from it, then drive off which is suspicious. I will also report to police.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 135, Tennyson Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing Neglect of Elmfield Avenue and Elmfield Street, 9th December
item.description:
I have been reporting the poor condition of both Elmfield Ave and Elmfield Street for almost three years now. It is obvious that the state of these roads is due to long-term neglect by the council, which is easy to verify by simply looking at Google Maps. Despite continuous reports from residents, nothing has been done. So I have to ask: what does it take for these streets to be repaired? Sixteen years of waiting should be more than enough. Does something have to happen before any action is taken? What exactly do we need to do for someone to finally address this, as part of their job?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3a, Elmfield Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
